subject: Football
lead_paragraph: Terrell Owens showed up for the Buffalo Bills’ voluntary workout sessions a few weeks late and wondered what all the fuss was about. With a shrug of his shoulders, Owens noted that he was not the first or only N.F.L. player to miss a session in which attendance is not mandatory. “That’s what’s so frustrating about the whole thing, is that everybody nitpicks at anything and everything I do,” said Owens, who is with his fourth team now that he has signed a one-year, $6.5 million contract with the Bills. ¶Florida’s attorney general sued a company that makes a Michael Vick dog toy, claiming proceeds from the sale were never donated to animal shelters as promised by the company. The lawsuit also claims the toy was not manufactured in the United States, as the Jacksonville-based Showbiz Promotions advertised, and consumers complained about delivery delays. Vick is serving prison time for bankrolling a dogfighting operation in Georgia and Virginia. vicktoy.
